issue.title: What did you developers do?

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did 
2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Correct.
> 
> @@ rules are telling AdGuard to not block an URL or to disable specific functions on the page (in this case generic hiding rules to avoid AdBlock detections). #%# rules are so called javascript rules which can overwrite site-s declared values. Such rules require Advanced protection though.

Oh my fuck I can’t thank you enough it’s working!!!! Perfectly!!!!!!!!! It’s working!!!! I could kiss you, I mean how can I repay you by giving you a review? Like I mean is there anyway I can repay you??????

issue.title: logitech.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBO-1.45.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.logitech.com/en-gb/products/mice.html

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Turkish filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

It only shows up in Chrome.
`qoe-jh.yottaa.net/log-jh`


<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![resim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110184059/209245237-5b72c3f6-ea9b-43b7-8523-e7e1a99a239b.png)

</details>



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Used to send visitor/site/session IDs, page category (seems different for search & product pages), and page URL via `navigator.sendBeacon` from Rapid+JS (`https://cdn.yottaa.com/rapid.security.min.7.1.1.js`), so looks like tracking.
EP blocks this via their `$third-party,ping` rule and it doesn't seem to break anything.
Both `hxxpx://www.uline[.]ca/` and `hxxpx://es.uline[.]mx/` use this script too.

comment.body:
Resolved by List-KR filter.
The patch will be available in up to 4 hours.
After that time, you can download it by clicking `Check for filter updates...` via AdGuard menu in your browser toolbar.

<details>
<summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

List-KR 필터에 의해 해결되었습니다.
패치는 최대 4시간안에 사용하실 수 있습니다.
최대 4시간이 지난 후에 브라우저 툴바에 있는 AdGuard 아이콘을 통해 `필터 업데이트 확인...`을 클릭하여 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did 
2. Screenshots

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

</details>

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did 
2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

comment.body:
The video is hosted on the website dood.re. That website is included on your main page (aka iframe).
And iOS treats the iframe as it's own.

Official filters are ours:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1200b5d42f2ff743be966bf157c588e89a974b26
Looks like it's used only there, so yep, not necessary.

comment.body:
iOS Safari thinks the iframe (embedded website) is their own, so when the embedded page requests google.com, iOS Safari treats that request as its own. Example:

Main page embeds secondary website. Secondary website makes request to google.com. On iOS Safari that request gets counted as if the main page made the connection. On Chrome Windows that request to Google.com is treated correctly made from secondary website.


--

With the help of iframes you can include live content from other websites in the own page (unless that other website is prohibiting it).

AdGuard Base

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
Note, `advanced blocking` should be turned on.

issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете AdGuard Browser Extension, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

pull_request.title: Removing popup blocker detection from all Postmedia sites
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request > Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\ > If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\ > It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\ > Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address #137757 ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Your comment The original report was for CalgarySun.com but the company that runs that newspaper has the same popup on all of their other local editions. This PR fixes the rest of them. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
### Terms - [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
> 

I am in Canada, if that helps. Using Adguard DNS with QUIC. Also using OISD basic alongside Adguard on android and OISD full on windows alongside adguard, I have tried disabling OISD on both android and windows and no success. So could be Adguard DNS, not sure. I searched reddit for this detection as well and there were some people who were experiencing this and some weren't so as you said could be region based. Is there a way to fix though? Like a custom filter entry we can input in user filters? I see that ublock reddit guys had a thread about it they came up with something, I tried those but didn't work for me. Thanks for looking into this, the places I download stuff from all use drop galaxy and I really need this to work, I am willing to provide any info needed.

issue.title: Removing popup blocker detection from all Postmedia sites

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request > Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\ > If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\ > It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\ > Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address #137757 ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Your comment The original report was for CalgarySun.com but the company that runs that newspaper has the same popup on all of their other local editions. This PR fixes the rest of them. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
### Terms - [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

labels.name: A: Problematic

issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
> Hi. Cannot reproduce. Do you have antivirus?

I do not.

> Is AdGuard detected on https://adguard.com/test.html ?

It is not detected.  Only when the settings is opened, then the problem goes away.  That makes no sense.  According to the icon in Safari, it should be working...

![Screen Shot 2022-12-23 at 12 30 19 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/586756/209392329-ff7d2b60-92d5-4f1b-9d9d-24fa0f382053.png)

So why is it saying "enabled" when it's not really enabled?

You don't expect me to keep the settings window open in the background in order to use the blocking... that can't be right?

So I closed the settings window and it's still running.  So the issue really seems to be that, Safari says it's enabled, but it's not really enabled until I open and close the settings window?  Something is goofy here.

I don't think the Safari icon should be saying "enabled" when it's not really enabled.
